title: German Chancellor Scholz draws fire over trade trip to China | DW News

media:group.media:title: German Chancellor Scholz draws fire over trade trip to China | DW News
media:group.media:description:
Germany's Chancellor Olaf Scholz pressed China on its support for Russia in Ukraine during talks in Beijing on Friday with Chinese leader Xi Jinping and Premier Li Keqiang.
Scholz also addressed controversy over economic and human rights issues. He is traveling with a business delegation and has faced calls to reduce Germany's over-dependence on its biggest trading partner. Allies like France and the US are critical of the visit. 
Scholz noted that he and Chinese leader Xi Jinping are coming together at a time of "great tension." He pressed China to exert its influence on Russia in the name of peace. But while Scholz was outspoken on Russia, Li Keqiang didn't even mention China's ally by name.
